hints_html:
We can always just try integrating the function on the left. What technique will work best?

Try a substitution.

Use \(\displaystyle u=5-2x\).
hints_latex:
We can always just try integrating the function on the left. What
technique will work best?
hints_raw:
We can always just try integrating the function on the left. What technique will work best?
Try a substitution.
Use <math> \displaystyle u=5-2x</math>.
question: 1 (d)
sols_html:
We proceed as in the hints. Let \(\displaystyle u = 5-2x\) so \(\displaystyle du = -2dx\). Substituting gives

\[\begin{aligned} \int\frac{7}{u} \left(\frac{\,du}{-2}\right) &= -\frac{7}{2} \int \frac{du}{u} \\ &= -\frac72 \ln|u| +C \\ &= -\frac{7}{2}\ln|5-2x| +C \\ &= k\ln|5-2x| + C\end{aligned}\]

Thus, \(\displaystyle k = -\frac{7}{2}\)
sols_latex:
We proceed as in the hints. Let $\displaystyle u = 5-2x$ so
$\displaystyle du = -2dx$. Substituting gives

\begin{align*}
\int\frac{7}{u} \left(\frac{\,du}{-2}\right) &= -\frac{7}{2} \int \frac{du}{u} \\
&= -\frac72 \ln|u|  +C \\
&= -\frac{7}{2}\ln|5-2x|  +C \\
&= k\ln|5-2x| + C
\end{align*}

Thus, $\displaystyle k = -\frac{7}{2}$
sols_raw:
We proceed as in the hints. Let <math> \displaystyle u = 5-2x </math> so <math> \displaystyle du = -2dx</math>. Substituting gives

<math>\begin{align}
\int\frac{7}{u} \left(\frac{\,du}{-2}\right) &= -\frac{7}{2} \int \frac{du}{u} \\
&= -\frac72 \ln|u|  +C \\
&= -\frac{7}{2}\ln|5-2x|  +C \\
&= k\ln|5-2x| + C
\end{align}</math>

Thus, <math> \displaystyle k = -\frac{7}{2}</math>
statement_html:
Find the value of k that makes the following antidifferentiation formula true:

\(\displaystyle \int\frac{7}{5-2x}\,dx = k\ln|5-2x| + C\)

where C is a constant.
statement_latex:
Find the value of \emph{k} that makes the following antidifferentiation
formula true:

$\displaystyle \int\frac{7}{5-2x}\,dx = k\ln|5-2x| + C$

where \emph{C} is a constant.
statement_raw:
Find the value of ''k'' that makes the following antidifferentiation formula true:

<math>
\displaystyle
\int\frac{7}{5-2x}\,dx = k\ln|5-2x| + C
</math>

where ''C'' is a constant.
